bibl.title: Laissez-passers in the Light of Documentary Evidence from Mons Claudianus, AD 98-117.
Proceedings of the 27th International Congress of Papyrology Warsaw, 29 July - 3 August 2013.

bibl.note: Mons Claudianus and its Roman administrative apparatus. - Who was the issuer of the laissez-passer? - Who was the addressee? - What information about travellers and dates of travel is contained in the laissez-passers? - Why are people prevented from using the quarries' roads without the laissez-passer? - What is the difference between the laissez-passer of Mons Claudianus roads and other permits for using the Eastern Desert roads?
bibl.seg: Yousry Deyab, Laissez-passers in the Light of Documentary Evidence from Mons Claudianus, AD 98-117.

Tomasz Derda, Adam Łajtar & Jakub Urbanik (edd.), in cooperation with Andrzej Mirończuk & Tomasz Ochała, Proceedings of the 27th International Congress of Papyrology, Warsaw, 29 July - 3 August 2013. Volume III. Studying Papyri = The Journal of Juristic Papyrology. Supplements. Volume XXVIII (Warsaw, 2016) pp. 1943-1960.

Mons Claudianus and its Roman administrative apparatus. - Who was the issuer of the laissez-passer? - Who was the addressee? - What information about travellers and dates of travel is contained in the laissez-passers? - Why are people prevented from using the quarries' roads without the laissez-passer? - What is the difference between the laissez-passer of Mons Claudianus roads and other permits for using the Eastern Desert roads?
